page.title: 08LIVERPOOL AIRPORT (cont)
page.content: opening on July 1st.1933, and is still remembered by many Merseysiders. The first regular air service from Speke linked Liverpool with Blackpool for 18 shillings return!As at most aerodromes in the thirties,flights were made from grass,hardcore runways not being built until after the war. The 1939-45 war was to make Speke famous for its British made bombers- Blenheims and Halifaxes. More than 4,600 bombers were built at Rootes factory on the Speke industrial estate.The Rootes factory is now owned by the Dunlop Rubber Company. Many R.A.F.squadrons,both training and operational, were based at Speke during the war, and many did convoy duty over the Western Approaches and the Atlantic.
